divs: sighting detailsi would have sent this in as soon as this happened but i had no idea mufon existed. i am watching http:\\speedstream.netro.ca\netrostream113\npcc.wmv and major george filer, iii stated this website's existance. on or about in the early half of november in 2000, at approximate 10:30 p.m. (i remember seinfeld was playing on channel 11--my family member was watching it), i decided to go to the supermarket by foot. one block north of jericho turnpike on 1st avenue between old steward and central avenue, as i was walking due east, i was actually praying to god and asked him to explain to me why there is so much suffering on earth, why does he allow us to stumble. i looked straight up over my head into the sky. it was night time and overcast with low clouds. a break in the clouds occurred and i saw the stars in the late night sky. i also saw a star brighter than venus traveling due east. i thought "wow, a shooting star" but instantly realized it was traveling slower than a shooting star but much faster than a plane. plus, it had no tail. it was just a very bright white big dot. after seeing it travel for two seconds in a straight line due east, it, without stopping, made a 90 degree turn and headed north without stopping, then clouds obscured my view. i turned around to see if anyone else was around, but unfortunately i was alone. i continued to walk towards the supermarket and wondered if it had anything to do with my prayer to god. was it his answer? i then processed what just happened and i concluded that because it was so bright, it must have been either so high that it could reflect sunlight or it was emitting it's own light. also, due to the high speed 90 degree turn, that no human could survive that maneuver. at all visible time this object traveled in straight directions, due east and due north. i am including a map of where i was when i saw this object. i remained calm during and after this experience. this is the first time i'm reporting this.
trends: There have been no other sightings in Garden City Park
This sighting has never been favorited.
